article.headline: Brown 68, New Hampshire 52
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Mark McAndrew scored 19 points as Brown defeated the University of New Hampshire 68-52 Thursday night. McAndrew scored three 3-point shots and moved into ninth place on Brown?s all-time list with 118 3-point baskets. Alvin Abreu paced the Wildcats (3-5), who?ve lost four in a row, with 14 points while Mike Christensen and Tyrece Gibbs added 10 points apiece. Brown (5-3) broke the game open early by building a 20-2 lead in the first eight minutes and never trailed. McAndrew keyed the surge by scoring eight points, including six on a pair of 3-pointers. The Bears held New Hampshire to only one basket in the first 13 1/2 minutes. Brown led 33-18 at halftime and increased its lead to as many as 19 points (44-25) on a layup by Adrian Williams with 12:50 left in the game. New Hampshire drew within 12 points on three occasions, the last at 56-44 on Gibbs' 3-pointer with 5:20 left. Brown shot 52.4 per cent (22-for-42) from the floor, compared with 34 per cent (18-for-53) for New Hampshire.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
